data:
T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size.
T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size.
T3 tumors are more than 5 cm in size.
T4 tumors involve the chest wall or skin.

T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size.
T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size.
T3 tumors are more than 5 cm in size.
T4 tumors involve the chest wall or skin.
T stage is assigned based on the largest dimension of the tumor, even if it is multifocal.

T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size.
T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size.
T3 tumors are more than 5 cm in size.
T4 tumors involve the chest wall or skin.
T stage is assigned based on the largest dimension of the tumor, even if it is multifocal.
The T stage does not consider the involvement of lymph nodes, which is evaluated separately for N stage determination.

T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size.
T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size.
T3 tumors are more than 5 cm in size.
T4 tumors involve the chest wall or skin.
T stage is assigned based on the largest dimension of the tumor, even if it is multifocal.
The T stage does not consider the involvement of lymph nodes, which is evaluated separately for N stage determination.
Tumor size is measured in the greatest dimension, regardless of the number or size of individual tumor foci.

T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size.
T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size.
T3 tumors are more than 5 cm in size.
T4 tumors involve the chest wall or skin.
T stage is assigned based on the largest dimension of the tumor, even if it is multifocal.
The T stage does not consider the involvement of lymph nodes, which is evaluated separately for N stage determination.
Tumor size is measured in the greatest dimension, regardless of the number or size of individual tumor foci.
For breast cancer, the T stage cutoffs are: T1 <= 2 cm, T2 > 2 cm and <= 5 cm, T3 > 5 cm.
